DataElement.preferredName: Patient Reproduction Pregnancy Breast Feeding Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the reproduction, ability to generate  offspring, pregnancy, state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), or breast feeding status of a patient or participant as a medical and/or social characteristic prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Reproduction Pregnancy Breast Feeding Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the reproduction, ability to generate  offspring, pregnancy, state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), or breast feeding status of a patient or participant as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Reproduction Pregnancy Breast Feeding Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Reproduction is the creation of one thing as a copy of, product of, or replacement for a similar thing.  It is commonly used in the context of biological reproduction and sex. (from Wikipedia):The condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body, after union of an ovum and spermatozoon. (Dorland, 27th ed):The nursing of an infant at the mother's breast.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: The generation of offspring by living organisms.
The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.
The nursing of an infant at the mother's breast.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Any of the following because
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any of the following because this study involves an investigational agent whose genotoxic, mutagenic and teratogenic effects on the developing fetus newborn are unknown: - Pregnant women - Nursing women - Men or women of childbearing potential who are unwilling to employ adequate contraception (as determined by the treating physician).

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient of childbearing potential?
